Fully vaccinated entrants with proof of completing a WHO-approved vaccine regimen no longer need to carry pre-departure test results. At least 14 days must have passed after completing vaccination to be considered as fully vaccinated. Others must submit negative results of a PCR test taken within 72 hours before departure. Outbound travelers from Bangladesh no longer require COVID-19 testing unless mandated by airline authorities or the destination country.    Officials have also lifted the system of varied quarantine periods based on travel origin. Symptomatic entrants - regardless of vaccination status - will undergo on-arrival testing; individuals who test positive must enter self-paid quarantine at a government facility or hotel for at least seven days. A repeat PCR test will occur after seven days; passengers must quarantine until they receive a negative test result.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220411173317/https://crisis24.garda.com/alerts/2022/03/bangladesh-authorities-lift-quarantine-for-asymptomatic-entrants-pre-departure-covid-19-test-requirement-for-vaccinated-arrivals-as-of-march-10-update-67

Relaxation measures continue to be introduced in Bhutan.    As of April 4th, The mandatory quarantine and testing for domestic travellers from high-risk areas are being withdrawn hereon. The high-risk areas include Thimphu, Wangduephodrang, Dukti chiwog under Yallang gewog and Jangphutse-Manam villages under Toedtsho gewog in Trashiyangtse, Merak and Sakteng gewogs in Trashigang and all bordering areas in southern Bhutan. They need not undergo home quarantine, either at place of origin or destination. Individuals who have entered home quarantine on or before April 3 will be allowed to travel on the enforcement date.     https://archive.ph/pyvOm

Visitors who are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 are currently required to undergo five days quarantine in Government-controlled facilities upon arrival into Bhutan, normally hotels. You may be required to show proof of vaccination .    https://web.archive.org/web/20220611232854/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bhutan/entry-requirements
no policy changes

The government announced a National Resilience Fund for mitigating COVID-19 linked to job losses and salary cuts. The support included grants for individuals directly affected by the pandemic (now extended until June 2022) and a full interest waiver on loans contracted from April 10, 2020, until June 2020. These measures were extended until September 2020, and partial (50 percent) interest waivers will continue until June 2022.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220305045842/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
no policy changes

The health ministry along with the Drug Regulatory Authority (DRA) has approved the use of COVID-19 antigen self-test kits in the country. The ministry approved the emergency use of the test kit as an increasing number of people are able to access it. Pharmacies registered with the DRA will be allowed to sell or distribute self-test kits.    However, individuals testing positive on self-test kits must report to 1010 for registration and monitoring by the clinical teams. The ministry will then facilitate immediate follow-up for vulnerable groups and monitor long COVID conditions.    Currently, there are around 60 COVID-19 testing centres across the country.    https://web.archive.org/web/20220429191007/http:/www.bbs.bt/news/?p=167880    https://web.archive.org/web/20220508193319/https:/www.gov.bt/covid19/11-04-22-%F0%9D%97%A5%F0%9D%97%B2%F0%9D%97%BD%F0%9D%97%BC%F0%9D%97%BF%F0%9D%98%81%F0%9D%97%B6%F0%9D%97%BB%F0%9D%97%B4-%F0%9D%97%BC%F0%9D%97%B3-%F0%9D%97%96%F0%9D%97%A2%F0%9D%97%A9%F0%9D%97%9C/

Vaccines are available for everyone above the age of 18 years. Bhutan has run a vaccination campaign for 12-16-year-old children, followed by 5-11-year-old children and providing booster doses to children 12-16 years old.     On April 18th, the health ministry rolled out the second booster or the fourth dose for those in the priority groups. The priority groups include the elderly above 65 years, persons with chronic medical conditions, all health workers, frontline workers and all outbound travellers above the age of 18. As per the ministry, close to 230,000 people are in the priority group.    Vaccines that have been approved include Covishield (AstraZeneca), Moderna, Pfizer BioNTech, and Sinopharm and they are fully funded by the Govt.    http://web.archive.org/web/20220418151636/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/bhutan/coronavirus  https://web.archive.org/web/20220418160519/https://www.moh.gov.bt/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220418161150/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/24-03-33-covid-19-booster-vaccination-for-children-12-to-17-years-old/    https://web.archive.org/web/20220429190649/http:/www.bbs.bt/news/?p=168108

No policy change found.  Is a curfew in place?  Yes, in some states and localities.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220604074255/https://in.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

No policy change found.  Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel?  Yes, some states require either proof of COVID-19 vaccination or a current negative test result and/or testing on arrival if entering from other Indian states. Additional quarantine may be required dependent on state of origin.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220604074255/https://in.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

No policy change found.  Arriving at an airport, all arrivals are screened. Anyone showing symptoms will be taken to a medical facility. There is also random testing on passengers -- at a rate of 2% of arrivals -- which is done at travelers' expense.  Anyone who tests positive on arrival will be taken to government isolation facilities, along with anyone seated within three rows of them on the airplane, and relevant cabin crew, whether or not they have tested negative. For more information see here.  Anyone showing symptoms will not be allowed to board their flight. Expect thermal screening before boarding.  Before departure, all travelers aged five years and older must upload a self-declaration form on the Air Suvidha Portal. They must also confirm that they will abide by any Covid-19 decisions taken around potential quarantine or testing, and that their declarations are correct.  Since February 14, those vaccinated with WHO-recognized vaccines, or in countries which have agreements of mutual recognition of vaccine certificates with India, have not needed to present a test on arrival. This covers 89 countries, including the US and the UK. You must upload your documentation alongside your self-declaration form.  Those who do not qualify, or who do not have the right documentation, must upload a negative PCR test taken within 72 hours of departure.  You will not be allowed to board your flight if you have not uploaded your documents.  On arrival, quarantine is no longer required. Instead, international passengers are requested to "self-monitor their health" for 14 days following their arrival.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220604083055/https://edition.cnn.com/travel/article/india-travel-covid-19/index.html

Are U.S. citizens required to quarantine? Yes. Travelers who have not received a full course of a COVID vaccine are required to quarantine at a government hotel for 7 days upon arrival in the country. Nepal schools reopened on February 13th:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220214234133/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/south-asia/schools-reopen-in-nepal-as-third-wave-of-covid-weakens/articleshow/89540371.cms

Nepal schools reopened on February 13th. In late April, the 10th-grade students completed their Secondary Education Examination (SEE) in Nepal.  Till the time they join higher education, there is a break of around three months.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220214234133/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/south-asia/schools-reopen-in-nepal-as-third-wave-of-covid-weakens/articleshow/89540371.cms  https://web.archive.org/web/20220530221031/https://english.onlinekhabar.com/school-student-use-break-productively.html

There are no restrictions on movements within Nepal with a vaccination certificate. Local and private transportation are available. Public transport and personal vehicles, including taxis, are permitted in the Kathmandu valley and must adhere to COVID protocols.  Violations of local orders may result in penalties. Long distance buses may be operating in some areas of the country. Additional restrictions remain possible in many locations.   https://web.archive.org/web/20220523163119/https://np.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  https://web.archive.org/web/20220307201443/http://www.xinhuanet.com/asiapacific/20220305/c56196aabeb8455abff9a196d31a61d3/c.html

Vaccinated visitors must present a certificate showing a negative RT-PCR test, taken within 72 hours of flight of first departure.  Unvaccinated people, or those unable to show that they have been fully vaccinated for at least fourteen days, are subject to free antigen tests on arrival. According to MoH Nepal, as of mid May 2022, 76.7% of the population have received the 1st dose and 67.8% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 8 Nepalese, 13% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered before June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of mid May 2022, 76.8% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.1% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/

According to MoH Nepal, as of early June 2022, 77% of the population have received the 1st dose and 68.4% are fully vaccinated. About 1 out of 7 Nepalese, 14% of the population has received a booster.  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523165444/https://covid19.who.int/region/searo/country/np/    According to covid-19 vaccine tracker Nepal has adminstered 9 vaccines (Moderna's Spikevax, Pfizer/BioNTech Comirnaty, Gamaleya's Sputnik V, Janssen's Ad26.COV2.S, Oxford/AstraZeneca's Vaxzevria, Serum's Covishield, Bharat Biotech's Covaxin, Sinopharm's Covilo and CoronaVac).  See link below:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220523164846/https://covid19.trackvaccines.org/country/nepal/  21 more million doses to be delivered by June 2022:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220131191839/https://mohp.gov.np/attachments/article/811/NEPAL%20COVID-19%20EMERGENCY%20RESPONSE%20AND%20HEALTH%20SYSTEMS.pdf    Government began administering booster dose of COVID-19 vaccine for people over 60:  https://web.archive.org/web/20220117204601/https://www.reuters.com/world/asia-pacific/nepal-starts-giving-covid-19-vaccine-booster-shots-2022-01-17/
